Dear Ms. Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (866) 685-0006.

ALLEGATION:
Within the last week, a staff dragged youth across the carpet which resulted in
carpet burns on youth.
INVESTIGATION:
This complaint was received 09/08/2022 and investigated in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist
I interviewed Chief Administrator on 09/09/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with
the DHHS Specialist. CA reported Nurse 1 called her on 09/08/2020 and informed
that Youth A had a scab mark on his arm, but no medical treatment was required.
She said the therapist spoke with Youth A and Youth A reported that he was doing
something he was not supposed to and that’s when Staff 1 pulled him by the leg.
Youth A could not remember when this incident occurred. CA said Staff 1 has been
employed at the facility since 05/23/2022 and has no discipline reports.
I interviewed Youth A on 09/09/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with DHHS
Specialist. Youth A was observed to have a scab on his left arm. Youth A reported
he got the scab, because he was not listening, and Staff 1 grabbed him by the leg.
He could not recall which leg was grabbed or when the incident occurred. He initially
said it happened two weeks ago and then said maybe was three weeks ago. He said
Staff 1 didn’t mean to hurt him and this happened by accident. Youth A could not
recall if anyone witnessed the incident, but he thinks maybe Staff 2 was working on
the day of the incident. Youth A said he didn’t tell anyone about the bruise when it
happened.
I interviewed Youth B on 09/09/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Youth B reported he gets enough to eat, gets his medication daily, and
feels safe. He denied witnessing staff do anything to hurt Youth A or to any other
youth at the facility. He said his favorite staff member is Staff 1. Youth B was eager
to go back outside, so he would not miss recess time.
I interviewed Youth C on 09/09/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Youth C has been at the facility for five years and his favorite staff
member is Staff 1. Youth C reported Staff 1 always makes time to listen to him and
he is nice. Youth C denied witnessing any staff member drag or doing anything to
hurt Youth A. Youth C said Youth A is very aggressive with staff and Youth A does
not like it when he does not get his way, but he has never witnessed staff do
anything to hurt Youth A. Youth C reported feeling safe and expressed no concerns.
3

I interviewed Nurse 1 on 09/09/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Nurse 1 reported she was doing a medication review for Youth A and
that’s when Youth A said he had a bruise on his arm. She examined Youth A and
observed a healing abrasion on his arm. Youth A told her that the staff did not do it
on purpose. Youth A did not provide specific details about when the incident
occurred. Nurse 1 reported the bruise had scabbed and it could not be determined
when it happened.
I interviewed Complainant/Therapist on 09/09/2022 at the facility, in collaboration
with the DHHS Specialist. Therapist reported he has been working with Youth A for
two months and Youth A had not reported any previous concerns regarding Staff 1
or any other staff. He reported Youth A struggles with being told “no” and will have
outbursts and tantrums when he does not get his way. Youth A told him on
09/06/2022 about the bruise on his arm and that it was caused by Staff 1.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 09/09/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Staff 1 has been working at the facility for 3 months and has completed
all his training including CPI. Staff 1 recalled a few days ago he took a marker away
from Youth A, because he was writing on his face. Youth A got upset, was crawling
on the floor, and tried to grab a pencil, so he grabbed him by his left ankle and
moved him away from the pencil. He moved him less then a foot away from the
pencil. Staff 1 said Youth A has a history of self-harming and he was trying to
prevent him from grabbing the pencil. He denied dragging or causing any injuries.
Staff 1 said Youth A did not report having any injuries or complained about being in
pain. He did not complete an incident report, because Youth A did not get to the
pencil, he was not injured, and Youth A did not report being hurt. Staff 1 said the
other youths were in their bedrooms and did not witness the incident.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 09/09/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Staff 2 denied witnessing any staff member dragging or doing anything to
hurt Youth A. He said Youth A is easily triggered and aggravated when he does not
get his way, so staff does redirect by talking to him. Youth A did not report being hurt
or having any injuries. Staff 2 said he has not had to restrain any youth and has not
witnessed staff restrain a youth.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 09/09/2022 via telephone, in collaboration with the
DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 1 reported he is not aware of any incident involving
Youth A being dragged on the floor and having injuries. Supervisor 1 said Youth A
does require a lot of redirecting because he is easily triggered when he does not get
his way. He said Youth A is manipulative and does not always tell the truth.
Supervisor 1 reported he has never observed Staff 1 grab or doing anything that
would hurt the youths. He said Staff 1 goes above and beyond in doing his job to
ensure the safety and wellbeing of the youths. Staff 1 does not have any discipline
on file.
4

I Interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist via telephone on 09/16/2022. She
reported Youth A has been at the facility for 3 months and has been making
progress. Youth A does have a history of threatening to hurt himself and make false
allegations, when he does not get his way, or he is redirected. She had been
meeting weekly with Youth A and he had not reported any concerns.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility’s Residential Treatment Overview/ Behavior management policy.
• Body chart for Youth A completed by Nurse 1 on 09/06/2022. Youth A had a
healing scab on his right forearm and lower back. No medical treatment
needed.
• Incident report dated 07/04/2022, completed by Staff 3. Youth A was upset
because staff offered him a snack and it was not what he wanted. Youth A
started to scream and throw things. Staff removed all the items out of Youth
A’s room for his safety. Youth A escalated more and tried to stick himself with
a pencil. Staff took the pencil away. Supervisor talked to Youth A and calmed
him down.
• Incident report dated 07/10/2022, completed by Staff 1. Youth A was
triggered because he lost his privilege to go offsite. Youth A was being
destructive by trying to break the heat vent and window. Staff 1 talked to
Youth A and helped calm down.
• Youth A treatment plan. Youth A has a history of aggressive behavior toward
staff and peers. When Youth A is triggered, he will punch, bit, push, throw and
break things. Youth A has been reported to threaten adults who reprimand
him or redirect him by saying he will report them for abusing him.
• Staff 1 employee file, No discipline reports
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4157 Behavior management.
(2) At a minimum, the behavior management system shall
include all of the
following:
(b) Positive intervention strategies to assist residents in
developing improved problem solving, self-management,
and social skills.
5

ANALYSIS: The facility is in violation of the rule. Staff 1 admitted to grabbing
Youth A by his left ankle to move him and prevent him from
grabbing a pencil because he thought Youth A might hurt
himself due to Youth A’s history of self-harming. This is not a
positive intervention strategy.
There is insufficient evidence that the healing abrasion on Youth
A’s arm was a result of Staff 1 grabbing Youth A by the ankle.
Youth A alluded to the nurse that the abrasion was caused by
staff 1 when he pulled his leg. Youth A was unable to provide a
timeline for when the incident occurred and said this happened
by accident. Staff 1 denied any prior knowledge that he caused
the abrasion. There were no witnesses, therefore it could not be
determined that the healing abrasion was caused by Staff 1
grabbing the youth’s ankle.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2021C0219004 - intake 10/08/20; CAP approved 11/23/2020
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status. This recommendation is contingent on the facility submitting an
acceptable corrective action plan for the noted violation.
